title: Ensure ogcard.jpg is deployed at IC asset canister root for OG/Twitter crawlers

requirements.summary: Add the OG/Twitter card image to the deployed frontend asset canister root as /ogcard.jpg so crawlers can fetch it directly.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains a root public asset at `frontend/public/ogcard.jpg`.
After deployment, requesting `https://www.prabhatchhirolya.com/ogcard.jpg` returns HTTP 200 with `content-type: image/jpeg`.
The returned image matches the intended OG dimensions (1200x630) and is not a 404/redirect-to-index response.

file_operations.description: Add the OG/Twitter card JPEG at the public root so it is deployed and served at `/ogcard.jpg`. Ensure the file is the intended 1200x630 JPEG and matches the existing canonical OG image (e.g., the existing generated OG JPEG) without changing UI/UX.

Update the deployment checklist/notes to explicitly confirm that `frontend/public/ogcard.jpg` is the source-of-truth asset deployed to `/ogcard.jpg`, and that it must be a 1200x630 JPEG returning `image/jpeg` (to prevent 404 or index.html fallback confusion).

requirements.summary: Confirm IC asset upload rules include ogcard.jpg and do not ignore it during deploy.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/.ic-assets.json5` includes an explicit rule that does not ignore `ogcard.jpg`.
A fresh deploy results in `ogcard.jpg` appearing in the asset canister root (served at `/ogcard.jpg`).

file_operations.description: Adjust/confirm asset canister rules so `ogcard.jpg` is explicitly included (not ignored) and, if supported by the config format, ensure headers are set/overridden so it is served as `image/jpeg` and not treated as a SPA fallback.

requirements.summary: Keep OG/Twitter meta tags pointing to the absolute ogcard.jpg URL with image/jpeg type.

file_operations.description: Verify and preserve existing Open Graph and Twitter meta tags so they continue to reference the absolute URL `https://www.prabhatchhirolya.com/ogcard.jpg`, and ensure `og:image:type` remains `image/jpeg`.
